column1: It is marvelous how much one can see out of the corner of the eye
column2: while seeming to view mere scenery.The driver looked down
column3: as he drove safely off the bridge
column4: and shook his head at the swirl of water that rushed and eddied
column6: close up under the rotten planking; then he cracked his whip
column7: and the horses sturdily attacked the little hill.Thick
column8: overhanging trees on either side now dimmed the light again
column9: and the two plump matrons once more glared past the opposite shoulders
column10: profoundly unaware of each other. The husbands took on the politely surly look required of them. The blonde son's eyes still sought the brunette daughter
column11: but it was furtively done and quite unsuccessfully
column12: for the daughter was now doing a little glaring on her own account. The blonde matron had just swept her eyes across the daughter's skirt
column13: estimating the fit and material of it with contempt so artistically veiled that it could almost be understood in the dark.
